snippet: The threat of force might get talks over Syria moving, as it did in Kosovo.
abstract: Op-Ed article by retired Army General Wesley K Clark holds American decision to provide lethal aid to Syrian rebels, alongside threat of escalated intervention, could open opportunity for concerted diplomacy to end bloodshed; cites end of conflict in Kosovo in 1999 as example of how threat of military force can significantly expedite negotiations.
lead_paragraph: The threat of force might get talks over Syria moving, as it did in Kosovo.
